qas.question: Along with non-governmental and nonstate schools, what is another name for private schools?
Along with sport and art, what is a type of talent scholarship?
Rather than taxation, what are private schools largely funded by?
What right do private schools have that public schools don't?
What is another name for a public school?
What kind of taxation funds private schools?

plausible_answers.text: depending on a talent the student may have

qas.question: What can help a student get a scholarship for a public school?

plausible_answers.text: financial need, or tax credit scholarships

qas.question: What are two reasons a student would be able to get a scholarship for a public school?
What are public schools allowed to do to retain talented students?

context: Private schools, also known as <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b4_0>independent<a0_0/> schools<b4_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/>, non-governmental, or nonstate schools, are not administered by local, state or national governments; thus, they retain the right <a3_0>to <a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>select their students<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> and are funded in whole or in part by <a2_1>charging their students <a2_0><a2_2>tuition<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, rather than relying on <b5_0>mandatory<b5_0/> taxation through public (government) funding; at some private schools students may be able to get a scholarship, which makes the cost cheaper, <b6_0>depending on a talent the student may have<b6_0/> (e.g. sport scholarship, art scholarship, <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>academic<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> scholarship), <b7_0>financial need, or tax credit scholarships<b7_0/> that might be available.
